subject: Pedal inputs erratic
description_text: Hello I have a set of simsonn pro plus pedals I got from a friend as a gift. Im having an issue when trying to calibrate them and reaching out to see if there is a fix. The problem im having is the inputs are jumping around without even touching the pedals at all making then impossible to calibrate. I tried grounding the control box and pedals themselves to a plug on the wall but that didn't seem to help at all. Is there an issue with the control box itself?

conversations.body_text: Hi jesse sturgill,   Please provide photos of the pedal and controller installation, and let us know the brand of your wheelbase. You can also share a video via Google Drive, and we will analyze all the information to provide you with a solution.

Hi jesse sturgill,  This level of numerical fluctuation is normal. Whether the pressure sensor is rated for 1–20 kg or 1–200 kg, when recognized in the 0–65536 range, it is impossible for the reading to remain perfectly static. A high-precision pressure sensor is not an angle sensor — any slight movement or vibration will cause the value to change. However, when this variation is scaled to the 1–100% range, it will not affect your actual pedal operation in the game. Additionally, please do not place the control box on the pedals. In practice, we only use the X, Y, and Z axes; all other axes can be ignored.

Hi jesse sturgill,  The white bar represents the raw data and can be ignored; just make sure the blue game data bar can go from 0% to 100% when fully pressed. After calibration, please rebind the button or pedal in the game.
